questions.question: Number system that uses only 0 and 1.
questions.explanation: Binary is the base-2 number system with two digits.

questions.question: Number system that uses digits 0-9.
questions.explanation: Decimal is the base-10 number system we use daily.

questions.question: Number system that uses digits 0-7.
questions.explanation: Octal is the base-8 number system.

questions.question: Number system that uses digits 0-9 and letters A-F.
questions.explanation: Hexadecimal is the base-16 number system.

questions.question: The base of the binary number system.
questions.explanation: Binary uses base 2 with two possible digit values.

questions.question: The base of the decimal number system.
questions.explanation: Decimal uses base 10 with ten possible digit values.

questions.question: The base of the hexadecimal number system.
questions.explanation: Hexadecimal uses base 16 with sixteen possible values.

questions.question: The base of the octal number system.
questions.explanation: Octal uses base 8 with eight possible digit values.

questions.question: The smallest unit of data in a computer, representing 0 or 1.
questions.explanation: A bit is a binary digit, the fundamental unit of information.

questions.question: Number system commonly used to represent memory addresses in computing.
questions.explanation: Hexadecimal is compact and convenient for memory addresses.
